title: Paths and Grounds of Guhyasamaja According to Arya Nagarjuna [ti
description:
Paths and Grounds of Guhysamaja according to Arya Nagarjuna is a very significant eighteenth century Tibetan treatise(with brief contemporary) which maps out the paths and the grounds of Guhyasamaja Tantra according to Arya Nagarjuna&#039;s tradition. It is based on the incomparable masterpieces of Manjushri, Lama Tsongkhapa and his hear-like disciples.

In many Buddhist Tantras and works of realised masters Guhyasamaja is refered to as &#039;the supreme and king of all Tantras". Acharya Chandrakirti&#039;s Bright Lamp(sgron gsal) states. "This (Guhyasamaja) is the supreme subsidiary practice; a compendium of the meaning of all Tantras".
